attributes.action: review and modify the current policy for the Early Years Foundation Stage, such that its requirements might be implemented without damaging the child’s introduction to school life, and without causing a loss to the profession of experienced, valuable and caring staff.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The requirement for ‘unique child assessment’ as currently proposed is difficult if not impossible to implement effectively.  It detracts from and fragments the teaching effort, and worryingly, it is resulting in an ever increasing loss to the profession of previously motivated practitioners.  The practicalities of looking after children in their early years do not appear to have been adequately addressed when setting the policy aims.    Current authoritative advice is simply to undertake ‘good planning’, but this does not recognise the logistics involved in tending to the constant, individual and changing needs (and demands) of a large group of 3 and 4 year olds.   Each child is (and has to be) treated as a unique individual, but to create a formalised and unique curriculum for each child is time consuming, inappropriate and unhelpful in the context of trying to engender a shared understanding of, and respect for the equally valid needs of friends, adults and society at large.
